content.description: To get to the start of this route you might have to walk around the back of the Half-Sphere Boulder and traverse over to the start. Start around the middle of this face of the Half-Sphere Boulder.
content.location: In the middle the face of the Half-Sphere Boulder that is around the right corner of the flat wall.

content.description: Basically just do easy climbing up to the top.
content.location: To the left of flood (around the corner to the left from Flood).

content.description:
Climb up the left side of the flat wall on Half-Sphere Boulder.

There may have rocks underneath in the water so check before climbing.
content.location: On the left side of the flat wall on the Half-Sphere Boulder.

content.description:
Left hand starts on a high crimp and right hand starts on a low crimp (your legs may be submerged in the water when starting the route). From starting crimps get you feet up and pull up to the crack. Move up the crack and then continue past the crack onto crimps and then to pretty good edge just before the top. Then top out.

ALSO: There is a rock under the water in the location of where you'd land if you where to fall. It is pretty deep in the water though, so even a fall from the top should be fine. Just watch out for that just in case.
content.protection: None since it is over water.
content.location: On the right side of the flat wall on the Half-Sphere Boulder.

pathTokens: Belton Bridge at Glacier National Park
